questions.text: 60-year-old male is being treated with quinine for severe malaria. During follow-up, he is monitored for potential adverse effects of the medication. All of the following are known adverse effects of quinine except:

A 72-year-old man comes to the emergency room because of a 4-day history of progressively worsening pain and swelling on the right side of his face. The patient was diagnosed with multiple myeloma 8 months ago and is currently undergoing treatment. examination shows erythema and swelling over the right cheek and mandible. An orofacial fistula is present. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of the drug that is most likely responsible for this patient's symptoms?

A physician is assessing the body composition of patients using various anthropometric indices. Which of the following indices is defined as height in centimetres divided by the cube root of body weight?

A 68-year-old male, chronic smoker, visited his physician with complaints of persistent cough, weight loss, and for the past few days, there was blood in his sputum. He also noticed an absence of sweating on the right side of his face. On examination, partial ptosis and constriction of the pupil were noted in the right eye. A PA view of a chest X-ray showed a lesion in the apex of the right lung. Which of the following structures does not form a posterior relation to the apex of the lung?
questions.correct_answer: A. Middle Trunk of Brachial Plexus

questions.text: All of the following are true about cochlear implant except:

options.label: A
options.text: The electrode of a cochlear implant is placed in the Scala tympani

options.label: B
options.text: Cochleostomy is then performed anteroinferior to the round window membrane to a diameter of 1.0 - 1.6 mm

options.label: C
options.text: Bilateral severe to profound sensorineural hearing loss is an absolute contraindication

options.label: D
options.text: Facial recess approach is most commonly used

questions.correct_answer: C. Bilateral severe to profound sensorineural hearing loss is an absolute contraindication
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Bilateral severe to profound sensorineural hearing loss is an absolute contraindication

questions.text: A 40 year old patient presents with chest pain and ECG was taken. What will be the likely vessel involved?
The Mizuo-Nakamura phenomenon is a characteristic finding seen in which of the following conditions?
Match the Genital ulcer disease in Column A with its clinical presentation in Column B:
The fracture seen in the x-ray given below is:
Which of the following is not a correct match with respect to the mechanism of action and clinical use of the given drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: Zavegepant – CGRP receptor antagonist used for the treatment of acute migraine attacks

options.label: B
options.text: Sparsentan – Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF

options.label: C
options.text: Lenacapavir – HIV-1 capsid inhibitor used for the treatment of HIV infection

options.label: D
options.text: Teplizumab – Anti-CD3 monoclonal antibody used for the prevention of type 1 diabetes in high-risk individuals

questions.correct_answer: B. Sparsentan – Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF

questions.text: A 16-year-old boy comes to the physician because of muscle weakness and cramps for 5 months. He becomes easily fatigued and has severe muscle pain and swelling after 15 minutes of playing basketball with his friends. The symptoms improve after a brief period of rest. After playing, he sometimes also has episodes of reddish-brown urine. Urinalysis shows: Blood: 2+ Protein: negative Glucose: negative RBC: negative WBC: 1-2/hpf Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's symptoms?

options.label: A
options.text: CTG repeat in the DMPK gene

questions.text: 50-year-old man with a history of TB presents with pedal edema, abdominal distention and distended neck veins. Chest X ray is shown below. Which of the following will be seen?

options.label: B
options.text: SBP fall from 80mm Hg to 60mm Hg during inspiration

questions.correct_answer: B. SBP fall from 80mm Hg to 60mm Hg during inspiration
questions.explanation: Ans. B) SBP fall from 80mm Hg to 60mm Hg during inspiration

questions.text: A 6-year-old girl with polycystic kidney disease is started on a new medication after receiving a kidney transplant from a matched, unrelated donor. Two days after starting the medication, laboratory studies show a leukocyte count of 17,500/mm (90% segmented neutrophils, 4% bands, 1% eosinophils, 3% lymphocytes, and 1% monocytes). Which of the following drugs is the most likely cause of these laboratory findings?
Identify this reflex:
A 65-year-old female patient is brought to the ER in a state of unconsciousness. Her BP is 70/50 mm of Hg. Her ECG is shown below. What is the next best step in the management of her condition?
What is the likely diagnosis?
A 34-year-old pregnant woman diagnosed with placenta percreta is scheduled for the triple P procedure. Which of the following is not involved in the triple P procedure for placenta percreta?

An investigator is studying the relationship between suicide and unemployment using data from a national health registry that encompasses 10,000 people who died by suicide, as well as 100,000 matched controls. The investigator finds that unemployment was associated with an increased risk of death by suicide (odds ratio = 3.02; p < 0.001). Among patients with a significant psychiatric history, there was no relationship between suicide and unemployment (p = 0.282). Likewise, no relationship was found between the two variables among patients without a psychiatric history (p = 0.32). These results are best explained by which of the following?

A 49-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 4-month history of fatigue and recurrent pain both of her wrists and her fingers. During this time, she has also had stiffness of her joints for about minutes after waking up in the morning. Examination shows swelling and tenderness of the wrists and metacarpophalangeal joints. Treatment is begun with a drug that results in decreased synthesis of dTMP. This mechanism is most similar to the mechanism of action of which the following drugs?
52 year old man collapses and you are giving CPR with your friend. What is ratio of chest compressions to rescue breaths?

A 45-year-old woman presents to her primary care physician with complaints of recurrent headaches and pulsatile tinnitus in her left ear. She has also noticed a throbbing sensation in her neck, especially on the left side. On physical examination, her blood pressure is 140/90 mmHg in the right arm and 160/100 mmHg in the left arm. There is a prominent bruit heard on auscultation over the left carotid artery. Her renal artery DSA is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient's symptoms?
Which of the following radioisotopes is commonly used as a source for external beam radiotherapy in the treatment of cancer patients?
Identify the correct statement:

options.label: A
options.text: C fibers are more sensitive to LA than A fibers.

options.label: B
options.text: A fibers are more sensitive to hypoxia than B fibers.

options.label: C
options.text: A fibers are more susceptible to pressure changes than C fibers

options.label: D
options.text: C fibers are more susceptible to hypoxia than B fibers

questions.correct_answer: C. A fibers are more susceptible to pressure changes than C fibers
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A fibers are more susceptible to pressure changes than C fibers

questions.text: A public health official is evaluating the data collected through the Integrated Disease Surveillance Project's P-FORM in a region known for its diverse ecology. The P-FORM is designed to report and monitor certain health events that have significant implications for public health. Which of the following health events is least likely to be under surveillance in this context?

A 13-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department by her father because of a severe nosebleed. She takes no medications and has no history of serious medical illness but has had frequent nosebleeds in the past. Physical examination shows brisk bleeding from the right nare and pooled blood in the posterior pharynx. The bleeding time is 11 minutes (N = 2-7). Which of the following is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy?

A 69-year-old man comes to the physician with a 2-year history of progressive hearing loss. His hearing is worse in crowded rooms, and he has noticed that he has more difficulty understanding women than men. He has no history of serious illness and does not take any medications. A Rinne test shows air conduction is greater than bone conduction bilaterally. This condition is most likely associated with damage closest to which of the following structures?
questions.correct_answer: A. Basal turn of the cochlea
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Basal turn of the cochlea

questions.text: A 23-year-old man is brought to the emergency department from a college party. He appears anxious and is markedly pale. His temperature is 38°C (100.49F), pulse is 104/min, respirations are 18/min, and blood pressure is 145/90 mm Hg. Physical examination shows diaphoretic skin, moist mucous membranes, and dilated pupils. Which of the following substances is most likely the cause of this patient's symptoms?

A 50-year-old patient presents with symptoms of kidney dysfunction, including fluid retention and elevated blood pressure. Further investigations reveal abnormalities in glomerular function. The healthcare provider suspects mesangial cell involvement. All of the following will cause mesangial contraction in the kidneys, except:
A patient after RTA presented with hypovolemic shock. What is the reason for decreased cardiac output in this patient?

Biopsy of a small, rounded rectal polyp demonstrates glands and sawtooth crypts composed of a proliferation of goblet and columnar epithelial cells as shown in the figure. No atypia is seen. This polyp is best classified as which of the following?

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a generalized, non-itchy rash for 2 days. He has also had a fever and sore throat for 4 days. He has not received any routine childhood vaccinations. Examination shows a flushed face except around his mouth. A diffuse, papular, erythematous rash that blanches with pressure is seen over the trunk. Pharyngeal erythema and a red beefy tongue are noted. His leukocyte count is 11,200/mm (75% segmented neutrophils, 22% lymphocytes). Without treatment, this patient's current condition puts him at greatest risk for which of the following complications?
Which one of the following is not a feature of liver histology in non-cirrhotic portal fibrosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Fibrosis in and around the portal tracts

options.label: B
options.text: Thrombosis of the medium and small portal vein branches

options.label: C
options.text: Non-specific inflammatory cell infiltrates in the portal tracts

questions.text: During the process of T- lymphocyte maturation, T cell receptors of many lymphocytes demonstrate a very high-affinity interaction with MHC molecules expressed on thymic medullary epithelial and dendritic cells. What process do these lymphocytes undergo at this time?

A 32-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-week history of recurrent thumb pain that worsens with exposure to cold temperatures. Examination shows a 6-mm, blue-red papule under the left thumbnail. The overlying area is extremely tender to palpation. The thumbnail is slightly pitted and cracked. This lesion most likely developed from which of the following types of cells?
A 54 year old man with dyslipidemia has triglyceride levels of 600 mg/dL despite treatment with rosuvastatin. What will be the nest step?
Which of the following neurons predominantly fire during forceful expiration?

In reviewing guidelines for various types of research studies, a medical researcher comes across several standardized reporting guidelines each aimed at improving the quality and transparency of research. Which of the following pairings of guidelines and study types is incorrectly matched?

Public health data over recent decades reveal significant shifts in global health challenges. Initially, the primary health concerns were infectious diseases; however, modern statistics indicate a rise in chronic diseases due to factors such as urbanization, industrialization, and changes in lifestyle. This shift in health priorities is best described as:
All of the following features are features of pseudohallucinations, except?

options.label: B
options.text: They are perceived in the objective space

options.label: D
options.text: They are not under the control of the patient

questions.correct_answer: B. They are perceived in the objective space
questions.explanation: Ans. B) They are perceived in the objective space

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department by her boyfriend 10 minutes after ingesting at least 15 acetaminophen tablets. She has been admitted to the hospital several times in the past few months after attempted self-harm. She claims that her boyfriend is " extremely selfish" and "does not care for her:." She says she feels lonely and wants her boyfriend to pay attention to her. Her boyfriend says that they have broken up 10 times in the past year because she is prone to outbursts of physical aggression as well as mood swings. He says that these mood swings last a few hours and can vary from states of "exuberance and affection” to states of "depression." On examination, the patient appears well-dressed and calm. She has normal speech, thought processes, and thought content. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following best describes the ABG findings: pH – 7.28, PaCO2 – 28 mm Hg, PaO2 – 98 mm Hg, Na– 140 mEq/L, K – 4.9 mEq/L, HCO3- 14 mEq/L, Cl – 100 mEq/L.

Consider the following statements regarding the use of malathion during epidemics: Assertion (A): Malathion is used as an Ultra-Low Volume (ULV) during epidemics. Reasoning (R): ULV fogging has a residual effect. Evaluate the correctness of these statements and the relationship between them.

options.label: A
options.text: A and R are true statements and R is the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R are true statements but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is true but R is false

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are false

questions.correct_answer: C. A is true but R is false

questions.text: After the administration of phenylephrine, the depicted images reveal an observed alteration. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 55-year-old man presents with complaints of facial swelling, frothy urine, and elevated blood pressure. He reports a previous hepatitis B infection. The kidney biopsy's histopathological image is shown below. What will be the IF finding in the patient?
Which of the following drugs used for cancers can cause hand-foot syndrome?
65-year-old lady with a history COPD and cor-pulmonale presents with breathlessness and frequent exacerbations. Which of the following will improve survival in this patient?
For which of the following parasites is NNN medium used for isolation? Leishmania donovani Giardia E. histolytica Trichomonas vaginalis Trypanosoma cruzi

A 13-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his mother because she is concerned about her son's behavior. She reports that he has been wearing her dresses at home and asks to be called Lilly. He also stopped going to swim class because he "doesn't feel comfortable in swim trunks." Since starting puberty about a year ago, he has not had any friends and the teachers report he is consistently being bullied at school. The mother further reports that her son has had mainly female friends since preschool. He appears shy. Physical examination shows normal male external genitalia. There is scarce coarse, dark axillary and pubic hair. Upon questioning, the patient reports that he would rather be a girl. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 69-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by his wife because of fever, cough, diarrhea, and confusion for 2 days. He recently returned from a cruise to the Caribbean. He has a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 40 years. His temperature is 39.1°C (102.4°F), pulse is 83/min, and blood pressure is 111/65 mm Hg. He is confused and oriented only to person. Physical examination shows coarse crackles throughout both lung fields. His serum sodium concentration is 125 mEq/L. Culture of the most likely causal organism would require which of the following mediums?

A 50-year-old male patient with bronchial asthma is currently on inhaler therapy with ipratropium and formoterol. Despite the medication, his symptoms are not improving due to hand mouth incoordination. What should be the next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: ﻿﻿﻿Add budesonide with monitoring of plasma levels of these drugs

options.label: B
options.text: ﻿﻿﻿Monitor plasma levels of ipratropium and formoterol

questions.text: A researcher is examining the relationship between socioeconomic status and IQ scores. The IQ scores of young Indian adults have historically been reported to be distributed normally with a mean of 100 and a standard deviation of 15. Initially, the researcher obtains a random sampling of 300 high school students from public schools nationwide and conducts IQ tests on all participants. Recently, the researcher received additional funding to enable an increase in sample size to 2,000 participants. Assuming that all other study conditions are held constant, which of the following is most likely to occur as a result of this additional funding?

options.label: A
options.text: Increase in range of the confidence interval

options.label: C
options.text: Decrease in standard error of the mean

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in risk of systematic error

questions.correct_answer: C. Decrease in standard error of the mean
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Decrease in standard error of the mean

questions.text: A 45-year-old male with Ischemic heart disease is posted for Coronary artery bypass graft surgery. You want beat to beat blood pressure measurement intraoperatively to guide you through the hemodynamic changes. Which among the following is the ideal artery for invasive blood pressure measurement?

A 57-year-old woman with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease develops end- stage renal disease and undergoes deceased-donor kidney transplantation. During the operation, the surgeon notices that the graft becomes cyanotic and mottled soon after its blood vessels are connected with those of the recipient. Blood flow to the graft ceases, and no urine is produced. Which of the following best explains the findings observed by the surgeon?

options.label: B
options.text: Antibody recognition of graft HLA components

options.label: C
options.text: Degranulation of recipient mast cells and basophils

questions.correct_answer: B. Antibody recognition of graft HLA components

questions.text: A patient with history of TB presents with hemoptysis. X ray is shown. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 34-year-old woman comes to the office due to double vision. The patient first experienced difficulty focusing her eyes while at work yesterday. On awakening this morning, her symptoms had progressed to frank diplopia. A complete physical examination is performed, including a full neurologic assessment. Shining light into the patient's right eye causes constriction of her right pupil, but not the left pupil. Shining light into her left eye causes constriction of only her right pupil. Which of the following additional physical examination findings is likely to be found in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Absence of the left corneal reflex

options.label: C
options.text: Inability to close the left eye

options.label: D
options.text: Inward deviation of the left eye

questions.correct_answer: B. Drooping of the left eyelid
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Drooping of the left eyelid

questions.text: A 66-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 1-week history of pruritic blister formation. Physical examination shows multiple 1-3 cm bullae on the palms, soles, lower legs, and inguinal folds. Gentle rubbing of the skin does not result in sloughing of the epidermis. Immunofluorescence studies of a perilesional skin biopsy specimen are most likely to show deposition of antibodies in which of the following areas?

HIV patient presents with breathlessness and cough. His recent CD4 count was less than 200 and patient’s chest X ray is shown. BAL was done and reports are pending. What is the likely diagnosis and treatment?
What percentage of the distribution corresponds to +2SD in a normal curve?
What would be your advice for a patient who has undergone a vesicovaginal fistula repair?

options.label: A
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 3 months and avoid pregnancy for a year

options.label: B
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 3 weeks and avoid pregnancy for 6 months

options.label: C
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 6 weeks and avoid pregnancy for a year

options.label: D
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 6 months and avoid pregnancy for 6 years

questions.correct_answer: A. Sexual abstinence for 3 months and avoid pregnancy for a year
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Sexual abstinence for 3 months and avoid pregnancy for a year

questions.text: 6-year-old boy is brought to the physician for evaluation of bilateral erythematous skin lesions on the flexures of the elbows and knees. He has been scratching the areas frequently. He has had similar lesions intermittently for the last 2 years. A photograph of the lesions on the knees is shown. This patient's skin lesions are most likely associated with which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Reversible decrease in FEV1/ FVC ratio

questions.correct_answer: A. Reversible decrease in FEV1/ FVC ratio
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Reversible decrease in FEV1/ FVC ratio

questions.text: A 45-year-old farmer presents with fever, malaise, and hepatomegaly. A liver biopsy is performed, and the histopathological slide is shown. Which disease is most likely associated with this histopathological finding?
Which of the following is not feature of the plane marked in the image?

options.label: A
options.text: External rotation of fetus happens here

options.label: B
options.text: It is at the level of the ischial spine

options.label: C
options.text: The curvature of the pelvis changes at this plane

options.label: D
options.text: Deep transverse arrests occur at this plane

questions.correct_answer: A. External rotation of fetus happens here
questions.explanation: Ans. A) External rotation of fetus happens here

questions.text: Which hormone increases during periods of stress, starvation, and deep sleep?

A 65-year-old female patient presents with gradual, progressive visual field loss in both eyes. Examination reveals increased intraocular pressure, cupping of the optic disc, and visual field testing shows arcuate scotoma. Which cell type in the retina is primarily affected in this patient's condition?
An infertile couple is being evaluated for infertility. They are advised to take a Sims-Huhner test. What is the purpose of this test?

options.label: A
options.text: To determine the viability of sperm

options.label: B
options.text: To assess the quality of cervical mucous

options.label: C
options.text: To evaluate the process of ovulation

questions.correct_answer: B. To assess the quality of cervical mucous
questions.explanation: Ans. B) To assess the quality of cervical mucous

questions.text: Which of the following snakes is NOT typically covered by the standard polyvalent snake antivenoms?

A patient presented with weakness of the right side of the face with loss of pain and temperature. Additionally, he experienced a loss of pain and temperature sensation in their left leg. The probable location of the lesion is:

In a patient with gastrointestinal symptoms, the dysfunction of which cellular structure, associated with the transmembrane protein Claudin, could potentially lead to altered permeability and paracellular transport?

A 62-year-old man with chronic liver disease is experiencing recurrent urinary tract infections. His healthcare team is considering various antibiotics, including fluoroquinolones, to treat the infection. Which of the following fluoroquinolones is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease?

A 51-year-old man with alcohol use disorder comes to the physician because of a fever and productive cough. An x-ray of the chest shows a right lower lobe consolidation and a diagnosis of aspiration pneumonia is made. The physician prescribes a drug that blocks peptide transfer by binding to the 50S ribosomal subunit. Which of the following drugs was most likely prescribed?

A 60-year-old female, was on treatment for diabetes for the last 10 years. She has experienced three episodes of Candidal vulvovaginitis in the last two months. Which of the following drugs should be avoided in this patient?
Which type of pelvis is associated with increased incidence of ‘face to pubis’ delivery?

A 56-year-old male presents to the emergency with abdominal pain and an episode of binge drinking, in shock with a BP of 70/50 mm Hg and HR of 115/min. The oxygen saturation of the patient is 70 mm Hg. The serum creatinine level was 2.4 mg/dL. What is the likely diagnosis based on the CT image shown below?
What is the mechanism of action when the retina is exposed to light?
questions.correct_answer: B. Hyperpolarization, decrease in neurotransmitter release

questions.text: Which test should a medical resident utilize to observe the characteristic pink feathery crystals that confirm the presence of hemoglobin in the degraded blood sample?
Where does the maximum water absorption occur within the renal tubules even in the presence of ADH?

A forensic expert is conducting an autopsy on an adult victim of suspected hanging. Examination of the neck is particularly focused on the hyoid bone, as fractures here can be indicative of the cause of death. In cases of hanging, where is a fracture of the hyoid bone most likely to be found?

options.label: A
options.text: Junction of the outer one-third and inner two-thirds of the greater cornu

options.label: B
options.text: Junction of the outer two-thirds and inner one-third of the greater cornu

questions.correct_answer: A. Junction of the outer one-third and inner two-thirds of the greater cornu
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Junction of the outer one-third and inner two-thirds of the greater cornu

questions.text: A third-year medical student is studying the anatomy of the hip joint for an upcoming exam. Which of the following ligaments is correctly paired with its primary function in stabilizing the hip joint?

options.label: A
options.text: Iliofemoral Ligament: Prevents Hyperextension of the Hip Joint

options.label: B
options.text: Ischiofemoral Ligament: Prevents Excessive Medial Rotation of the Hip Joint

options.label: C
options.text: Pubofemoral Ligament: Limits Abduction and External Rotation of the Hip Joint

options.label: D
options.text: Ligamentum Teres: Primary Stabilizer of the Hip Joint in all Movements

questions.correct_answer: A. Iliofemoral Ligament: Prevents Hyperextension of the Hip Joint
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Iliofemoral Ligament: Prevents Hyperextension of the Hip Joint

questions.text: A 23-year-old man comes to the OPD due to penile ulcers that appeared after unprotected sexual intercourse. Physical examination shows 3 subcentimeter ulcers on the penile shaft. Microscopic examination of a scraping from an ulcer base reveals the following. Which of the following medications is most appropriate for this patient?

A 45-year-old male patient has recently undergone renal transplantation. To minimize the risk of transplant rejection, the medical team is considering the use of an immunosuppressive agent that specifically targets T-cell activation without causing generalized immunosuppression. Among the options, they are discussing basiliximab. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of basiliximab?
Following are the various investigations pertaining to various ear disorders. Identify them in sequence. A) B) C) D)

options.label: A
options.text: Otosclerosis, Acoustic neuroma, Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease

options.label: B
options.text: Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease, Otosclerosis, Acoustic neuroma

options.label: C
options.text: Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease, Acoustic neuroma, Otosclerosis

options.label: D
options.text: Otosclerosis, Meniere’s disease, Acoustic neuroma, Noise induced hearing loss

questions.correct_answer: C. Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease, Acoustic neuroma, Otosclerosis
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease, Acoustic neuroma, Otosclerosis

questions.text: Two days after undergoing left hemicolectomy for a colonic mass, a 62-year-old man develops shortness of breath. His temperature is 38.1 °C (100.6°F), pulse is 80/min, respirations are 22/min, and blood pressure is 120/78 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 88%. Cardiopulmonary examination shows decreased breath sounds and decreased fremitus at both lung bases. Arterial blood gas analysis on room air shows: PH: 7.35 PaO2: 70 mm Hg PCO2: 40 mm Hg An x-ray of the chest shows a collapse of the bases of both lungs. Which of the following is the most likely underlying mechanism of this patient's hypoxemia?
questions.correct_answer: C. Decreased ratio of ventilated alveoli
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Decreased ratio of ventilated alveoli

questions.text: A 25-year-old man presents to the emergency department with palpitations. His ECG is shown in the image. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Which of the following is/are incorrectly matched? 1. Sternoclavicular joint - Plane synovial joint 2. Wrist and knuckle joints - Hinge variety of synovial joints 3. Middle tibiofibular joint - Syndesmosis 4. Calcaneocuboid joint - Saddle synovial joint 5. Elbow and ankle joint - Ellipsoid synovial joint
Which of the following is not a feature of complicated cataracts?
A 34y G2P1 with a previous LSCS presented at 30 weeks with painless vaginal bleeding. The following was seen on the ultrasound. Which is not seen in placenta accreta?

options.label: B
options.text: Disruption of the bladder-uterine serosal interface

options.label: D
options.text: Bridging vessels from the placenta to the bladder-serosal interface

questions.correct_answer: A. Thickening of the retroplacental myometrium
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Thickening of the retroplacental myometrium

questions.text: 34 year old patient presented with fever, headache, vomiting and neck stiffness. Lumbar puncture was performed and the reports are as follows – Opening pressure – elevated, Appearance – cloudy, Cell count – 80 (70% Lymphocytes), Sugar – 35 mg/dL, Protein – 200 mg/dL. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 55-year-old man presents to the emergency department with severe chest pain after eating a piece of steak. The pain started suddenly and radiates to his back. He also reports difficulty swallowing, and is drooling saliva. His vital signs are stable. Physical examination reveals tenderness over the lower chest and upper abdomen. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 5-year-old child is brought to the Pediatrics OPD with eczematous rash over the skin. His past history reveals that he had recurrent skin infections and pneumonia in the past six months. Hemogram reveals low platelet count. Which of the following investigations should be done in this patient?

A 32-year-old woman comes to the physician because she feels depressed, has difficulty sleeping, a poor appetite, and low concentration for the past 3 months. During this time, she has also had low energy. During high school, the patient went through similar episodes of low mood and poor sleep. At that time, she would repeatedly engage in binge eating and purging behavior, for which she was referred to therapy. There is no evidence of suicidal ideation. The physician offers to prescribe a medication for her current symptoms. Treatment with which of the following drugs should most be avoided in this patient?

A clinical trial is conducted to determine the role of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) beta-amyloid levels as a biomarker in the early detection and prognosis of Alzheimer disease. A total of 100 participants are enrolled and separated into three groups according to their Mini- Mental State Examination (MMSE) score: mild dementia (20-24 points), moderate dementia (13-20 points), and severe dementia (< 13 points). Participants' CSF level of beta-amyloid 42 is measured using an immunoassay. It is found that participants with severe dementia have a statistically significantly lower mean CSF level of beta-amyloid 42 compared to the other two groups. Which of the following statistical tests was most likely used to compare measurements between the study groups?
Most common cancer in India in females is:

In a public health survey conducted in rural Odisha, a 36-year-old woman is found to have a hemoglobin (Hb) level of 15.0 g/dl. This finding is particularly noteworthy as the survey data shows that the mean Hb level among the women in this area is 13.5 g/dl, with a standard deviation of 1.5 g/dl. To contextualize the woman's Hb level within the study's data, the researcher uses the concept of Z-scores. Based on this information, what is the Z-score for this woman's hemoglobin level?

A 46-year-old man comes to the physician for a follow-up evaluation one week after being discharged from the hospital for acute pancreatitis and alcohol withdrawal. He drinks 8 to 10 beers daily. When the physician asks him about his alcohol use, the patient says, "This is the second time in a year that I have experienced such severe belly pain because of my pancreas. I realize that it really could be happening because of the amount of alcohol I am drinking. However, I don't think I have the willpower to cut down." This patient is most likely in which of the following stages of behavioral change?
Match the following signs seen in acute appendicitis with their respective features?
Which of these is the definition of effective CPR? Respiratory rate: 20 - 24 breaths per minute. Chest compressions: 100-120/min. Allow complete chest recoil. 5-6 cm depression.
In a Preoperative surgical safety Checklist, which of the following is not a component?

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department because of nausea and vomiting for 1 day. His maternal uncle had a seizure disorder and died in childhood. He appears fatigued. Respirations are 32/ min. Examination shows diffuse weakness in the extremities. Serum studies show a low pH, elevated lactate concentration, and normal blood glucose. A metabolic condition characterized by a defect in oxidative phosphorylation is suspected. Microscopic examination of a muscle biopsy specimen of this patient is most likely to show which of the following findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Fibrofatty replacement of normal muscle fibers

questions.text: What is the action of the superior oblique muscle?
Which of the following statements is false regarding scleredema?

options.label: A
options.text: Can occur in association with diabetes

options.label: B
options.text: Associated with sclerodactyly and Raynaud’s phenomenon

options.label: C
options.text: The dermis is 3-4 times thicker than normal

options.label: D
options.text: Erythema and peau d'orange appearance of the skin can be seen

questions.correct_answer: B. Associated with sclerodactyly and Raynaud’s phenomenon

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman, gravida 2, para 1, at 30 weeks' gestation comes to the physician for evaluation of increased urinary frequency. She has no history of major medical illness. Laboratory studies show an increased serum C-peptide concentration. Ultrasonography shows polyhydramnios and a large for gestational age fetus. Which of the following hormones is predominantly responsible for the observed laboratory changes in this patient?

A male patient with benign hypertrophy of the prostate was hospitalized for three weeks. During his stay, he developed signs suggestive of a catheter-associated urinary tract infection (UTI). The tip of his urinary catheter was cultured on blood agar and, after 24 hours, the agar showed the distinctive pattern as in the image provided. Which organism is most likely the causative agent of the UTI in this patient?

A male newborn born at 27 weeks' gestation is evaluated for rapid breathing and hypoxia shortly after birth. His mother had no prenatal care. Cardiopulmonary examination shows normal heart sounds, intercostal retractions, and nasal flaring. An x-ray of the chest shows low lung volumes, air bronchograms, and diffuse ground-glass opacities. He is started on nasal continuous positive airway pressure. Further evaluation of this patient is most likely to show which of the following findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral pleural effusions on lung ultrasound

options.label: B
options.text: Hyaline membranes lining the alveoli on lung biopsy

questions.correct_answer: B. Hyaline membranes lining the alveoli on lung biopsy
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Hyaline membranes lining the alveoli on lung biopsy

questions.text: Splenectomy in contraindicated in which of the following conditions?

A 12-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with severe chest pain. He has had intermittent substernal chest pain for the past few months that typically occurs after heavy activity. Troponin is elevated, and ECG reveals ST segment elevations in leads II, III, and aVF. After acute stabilization and treatment, further laboratory workup shows an increased serum methionine level. Which of the following amino acids is most likely essential in this patient?

A nephrology resident is planning a research study to assess renal function in patients with suspected chronic kidney disease. The study aims to accurately determine the filtration fraction of the kidneys using substances that are well-characterized in renal physiology. Which combination of substances should be used to measure the filtration fraction?

A student after a heavy lunch from the hostel got ready for his afternoon class. After a while he yawned widely. To his surprise sadly he could not close his mouth. The jaw was stuck. Which of the following statement is not true in the above scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: This is a case of anterior dislocation of temporomandibular joint

options.label: B
options.text: Temporomandibular joint is a bicondylar type of synovial joint

options.label: C
options.text: Contraction of medial pterygoid depresses the mandible

options.label: D
options.text: Sphenomandibular ligament is situated medial to temporomandibular joint

questions.correct_answer: C. Contraction of medial pterygoid depresses the mandible

questions.text: Which among the following species is transmitted through the vector given in the image?

A 35-year-old man with a history of RTA with intense pain in the suprapubic region. On examination, abdominal distention was present. Heart rate and blood pressure was normal. Imaging is shown below. What is the diagnosis?
A woman presents to the STI clinic with pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) and is given a yellow kit for herself and a kit for her husband. Which of the following kits will be given to her husband?

A 35-year-old male presented with fever, confusion and altered mental status. On examination he has jaundice, reduced urine output, low BP and feeble pulse. Lab studies reveal severe anemia, thrombocytopenia and elevated liver enzymes. Peripheral smear revealed P. falciparum. What is the best treatment?

A new antiarrhythmic drug is found to be effective against both atrial and ventricular arrhythmias. Its effect on action potential is shown in the Figure. The effect of this new drug is most similar to?

A healthy 31-year-old woman comes to the physician because she is trying to conceive. She is currently timing the frequency of intercourse with at-home ovulation test kits. An increase in the levels of which of the following is the best indicator that ovulation has occurred?

Identify the incorrect statements: Richardson and Koeppe are direct gonioscopes. Narrowing of isopters and the appearance of a blockage within the blind spot are early changes in MS M ost common ocular manifestation of COVID-19 is papillary conjunctivitis The Haigis-L regression formula is used for lens power calculation in patients undergoing cataract surgery with a past history of LASIK for myopia. Correct method is to put the eye ointment first, drops 15 min later

A 16y girl is brought to the OPD as she has not started her period. The patients 14y sister underwent menarche 2 years earlier and her mother began menstruating at age 13. She has no weight gain, headaches, nipple discharge or abdominal pain. She is not sexually active and is not using any method of contraception. She is physically active and is on her school’s basketball team. Her breast exam and pubic hair are Tanner stage IV. The abdomen is soft. The external genitalia appear normal. The vagina ends in a blind pouch. An ultrasound reveals ovaries, but no cervix or uterus is seen. Which is the most likely diagnosis?

Identify the correct statements: Tranexamic acid reduces risk of mortality only in patients of penetrating trauma with no role in blunt trauma cases All patients after trauma with signs of shock should receive tranexamic acid within 3 hours of injury Crystalloids are preferred over blood and blood products for resuscitation of severely hypovolemic patients of trauma The first step in primary survey in field trauma patient is control of any exsanguinating hemorrhage

A 2600-g male newborn is delivered at 34 weeks' gestation to a 22-year-old woman. The mother did not have prenatal care. Upon examination in the delivery room, the newborn's skin appears blue. He is gasping and breathing irregularly. The ears are low-set with broad auricles, and the nasal tip is flattened. The lower jaw is small and displaced backward. The right foot is clubbed. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's condition?

A 33-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 4-day history of fever, anterior neck pain, and throat swelling. Her temperature is 38.1°C (100.6°F) and pulse is 109/min. Physical examination shows diaphoresis and a fine tremor of the outstretched hands. The thyroid gland is enlarged, firm, and tender to palpation. Serum thyroid stimulating hormone level is 0.06 µIU /mL and erythrocyte sedimentation rate is 65 mm/h. I-123 scan shows an enlarged thyroid gland with diffusely decreased uptake. Histologic examination of a thyroid biopsy specimen is most likely to show which of the following findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Noncaseating granulomas with multinucleate giant cells

options.label: B
options.text: Undifferentiated giant cells with areas of necrosis and hemorrhage

options.label: D
options.text: Lymphocytic infiltration with germinal follicle formation

questions.correct_answer: A. Noncaseating granulomas with multinucleate giant cells
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Noncaseating granulomas with multinucleated giant cells

questions.text: A 58-year-old hypertensive patient with a history of MI presents with an acute attack of migraine. Which of the following medications should not be given?
A 27-year-old woman, G2A1, at 28 weeks’ gestation with blood type B negative, has an Indirect Coombs Test (ICT) result of 1:32. What is the next best step in her management?
questions.correct_answer: A. Perform ultrasound assessment including MCA-PSV

questions.text: Vaccine associated paralytic poliomyelitis is defined as those cases of acute flaccid paralysis?

options.label: A
options.text: Who have residual weakness 6 months after the onset of paralysis and from whose stool samples, vaccine related poliovirus but no wild virus is isolated.

options.label: B
options.text: Who have residual weakness 60 days after the onset of paralysis and from whose stool samples, vaccine related poliovirus but no wild virus is isolated.

options.label: C
options.text: Who have residual weakness 6 days after the onset of paralysis and from whose stool samples, vaccine related poliovirus but no wild virus is isolated.

options.label: D
options.text: Who have residual weakness 60 days after the onset of paralysis and from whose stool samples, wild polio virus is isolated.

questions.correct_answer: B. Who have residual weakness 60 days after the onset of paralysis and from whose stool samples, vaccine related poliovirus but no wild virus is isolated.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Who have residual weakness 60 days after the onset of paralysis and from whose stool samples, vaccine related poliovirus but no wild virus is isolated

questions.text: In a patient undergoing treatment for head and neck cancer, the decision on the extent of neck dissection is crucial. A supra omohyoid selective neck dissection involves the removal of which levels of lymph nodes?
A 15-year-old male with pain and swelling gradually increasing over 4 months at the upper end of tibia. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 34 years old male came with pain and watering in the right eye for 36 hours. On examination, a 3x2 cm corneal ulcer is seen with elevated margins, feathery hyphae, finger like projections and minimal hypopyon in cornea. What is the likely causative organism?

In a research study focusing on the structural analysis of antibodies, a team is using papain to understand the functional components of immunoglobulins. Papain, a proteolytic enzyme, is utilized to dissect antibodies into their respective parts. Based on this application, what are the expected products when papain digests an immunoglobulin molecule?
Which of the following conditions is most likely NOT X-linked? Wilson’s disease Hemophilia A Thalassemia G6PD deficiency ABO blood groups system

A 35-year-old male who recently had a laparoscopic cholecystectomy presents on postoperative day 3 with fever. An ultrasonographic evaluation reveals a 5x5 cm fluid collection in the right subdiaphragmatic space. What is the most appropriate next step in managing this patient's condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Re-explore the wound with T-tube insertion

questions.text: This device shown in the image is used in:
questions.correct_answer: A. Men with suspected urethral stricture
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Men with suspected urethral stricture

questions.text: 45-year-old man comes to the physician for a follow-up examination after being diagnosed with hypertension 6 months ago. An antihypertensive medication is prescribed that decreases blood pressure by decreasing the transmembrane calcium current across vascular smooth muscle cells. Side effects include peripheral edema and flushing. Which of the following best describes why this drug does not affect skeletal muscle contraction?

options.label: A
options.text: Skeletal muscle lacks voltage-gated L-type calcium channels

options.label: B
options.text: Skeletal muscle contraction occurs independently of extracellular calcium influx

options.label: C
options.text: Skeletal muscle ryanodine receptor activation occurs independently of membrane depolarization

options.label: D
options.text: Skeletal muscle preferentially expresses N- type and P-type calcium channels

questions.correct_answer: B. Skeletal muscle contraction occurs independently of extracellular calcium influx
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Skeletal muscle contraction occurs independently of extracellular calcium influx

questions.text: Identify the type of covering used for burns wound:

27-year-old woman, gravida 2 para 1, at 28 weeks gestation comes to the office for follow-up of an abnormal Pap test. She feels fetal movement, has no vaginal bleeding or contractions, and has had an uneventful pregnancy to date. The patient's previous pregnancy 5 years ago was uncomplicated. She has not had a previous abnormal Pap test, but the last test was performed during her prior pregnancy. She takes a multivitamin and an iron supplement. Blood pressure is 120/74 mm Hg and pulse is 82/min. Fetal heart tones are normal. Physical examination reveals a gravid, nontender uterus. The cervix is long, closed, firm, and posterior, and the fetal presenting part is high. The Pap test showed a high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

A previously healthy 28-year-old woman comes to the emergency department for evaluation of intractable vomiting and uterine cramping. Her last menstrual period was 7 weeks ago. Serum ß-human chorionic gonadotropin concentration is 170,000 mIU/mL. A transvaginal ultrasound shows the following. The patient undergoes dilation and suction which shows hydropic villi with diffuse, circumferential trophoblastic proliferation. Karyotype analysis of the specimen is most likely to show which of the following?

During a training session for emergency responders, a discussion focuses on the categorization of bioterrorism agents according to their threat level and potential for public health impact. Which organisms are included in Category ‘A’ for bioterrorism threats, indicating the highest priority organisms that pose a risk to national security? Vibrio cholera Clostridium botulinum Yersinia pestis Bacillus anthracis Burkholderia mallei

An alcoholic developed intractable vomiting for 2 days with loose motions. Since he had decreased food intake and altered sensorium, he was brought to the hospital, where the fluid loss and dyselectrolytemia was aggressively corrected with fluid infusion. Post treatment, the patient started having quadriplegia and mutism. MRI is shown below. What is the diagnosis?
Puerperal pyrexia is defined as:
questions.correct_answer: B. Temp > 100.4 F occurring 24h after delivery
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Temp > 100.4 F occurring 24h after delivery

questions.text: In the context of the National Tuberculosis Elimination Program (NTEP), how is a high priority TB-HIV district defined based on the criteria set for integrating TB and HIV control measures?

options.label: A
options.text: More than 10% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

options.label: B
options.text: More than 12% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

options.label: C
options.text: More than 15% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

options.label: D
options.text: More than 20% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

questions.correct_answer: A. More than 10% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) More than 10% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

questions.text: A 62-year-old woman with type 2 diabetes mellitus comes to the physician because of a 1-year history of progressively worsening paresthesias in her upper limbs. She has accidentally burned her fingers on hot dishes several times. She was involved in a motor vehicle collision 3 years ago. Neurologic examination shows absent temperature sensation with normal fine touch sensation over the upper extremities and chest. Without treatment, this patient is at increased risk of developing which of the following?

Match the following local anesthetic agents with the appropriate description: Local anesthetic used as antiarrythmic Longest-acting local anesthetic Shortest-acting local anesthetic Only naturally occurring local anesthetic with vasoconstrictive properties Chloroprocaine Lignocaine Dibucaine Cocaine
Which ministry is responsible for overseeing the Food Standards and Safety Authority of India (FSSAI)?

options.label: C
options.text: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

questions.correct_answer: C. Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

questions.text: A 41-year-old man presents with progressive fatigue, pruritus, and jaundice over several months. He underwent a colectomy 5 years ago for ulcerative colitis. Physical exam reveals generalized jaundice without abdominal pain or masses. Lab results show a serum alkaline phosphatase level of 285 U/L. Cholangiography indicates widespread obliteration of intrahepatic bile ducts and a beaded appearance in remaining ducts. Which of the following morphologic features is most likely present in his liver?

options.label: A
options.text: Piecemeal hepatocellular necrosis at the interface of portal tracts

options.label: B
options.text: Portal bridging fibrosis with nodular hepatocyte regeneration

questions.text: Match each device listed in Column A with the maximum FiO2 it delivers, as shown in Column B. Column A: High Flow Nasal Cannula (HFNC) Non-Rebreather Mask (NRBM) Hudson Mask Nasal Cannula at 3 L/min Oxygen Flow Column B: 30-35% Fio2 90% -100 % FiO2 Up to 90% FiO2 40-60% FiO2

A 45-year-old male patient presents with recurrent episodes of palpitations and dizziness. An echocardiogram reveals an enlarged right atrium and evidence of a right-to-left shunt. During the cardiac catheterization procedure, the cardiologist observes a valve-like structure within the right atrium. Which of the following structures guards the opening of the coronary sinus and may be contributing to the patient's symptoms?

A 56-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by his neighbor 2 hours after ingesting an unknown substance in a suicide attempt. His temperature is 39.1°C (102.4°F), pulse is 124/min, respiratory rate is 12/min, and blood pressure is 150/92 mm Hg. His skin is dry. Pupils are 12 mm and minimally reactive. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for this patient's condition?
Identify the likely pathology from the thyroid scan pattern shown in the figure:

A newborn is assessed at 1 minute after birth. Calculate the APGAR score based on the following findings: Heart rate: 110 beats per minute Respiratory effort: Strong cry Muscle tone: Some flexion of arms and legs Reflex irritability: Grimace on stimulation Color: Body pink, extremities blue
A 72-year-old patient with Parkinsonism presents with swollen, red, tender, and very painful feet. Which medication, if discontinued, could likely resolve these symptoms within a few days?
The following test is used for the assessment of:

A 35-year-old woman, gravida 2, para 1, at 16 weeks' gestation comes to the OPD for a prenatal visit. She reports increased urinary frequency but otherwise feels well. Pregnancy and delivery of her first child were uncomplicated. Urinalysis shows mild glucosuria. Laboratory studies show a non-fasting serum glucose concentration of 100 mg/dL. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for this patient's glucosuria?

A 16-year-old boy was diagnosed with urethral stricture. He underwent visual internal urethrotomy in the lithotomy position with stirrups supporting both popliteal fossa and proximal parts of tibia. No ankle support was used. On the first postoperative day, the patient complained of decreased sensation on the lateral aspect of right leg, the lateral border of his right foot and difficulty in dorsiflexion of the right foot due to compression of a particular nerve of the lower limb. Which of the following muscles is supplied by the nerve involved in this scenario?
Rossmann fold associated NADH domain is found in which enzyme:

A 38-year-old woman undergoes hemithyroidectomy for treatment of localized, well-differentiated papillary thyroid carcinoma. The lesion is removed with clear margins. However, during the surgery, a structure lying directly adjacent to the superior thyroid artery at the upper pole of the thyroid lobe is damaged. This patient is most likely to experience which of the following symptoms?
Match the following images: Venous ulcer Marjolin ulcer Arterial ulcer Trophic ulcer
During the Queckenstedt test, CSF pressure fails to rise upon compression of the jugular veins. What does it indicate?

A 41-year-old female presents in the outpatient department reporting that she passes blood instead of urine during the night. Genetic testing reveals a mutation in the PIGA gene. She undergoes a series of laboratory tests including the Ham test. What is the primary abnormality detected by the Ham test?

options.label: D
options.text: Lysis of RBCs in a mildly acidic pH

questions.correct_answer: D. Lysis of RBCs in a mildly acidic pH
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Lysis of RBCs in a mildly acidic pH

questions.text: A surgeon is performing a dissection in the shoulder region and notes the structures passing through the clavipectoral fascia. Which of the following structures is known to pierce the clavipectoral fascia?

A 4-year-old child presents with a history of progressive weakness, irritability, and delayed growth. Physical examination reveals wrist and costochondral joint swelling, as well as bowing of the legs. A wrist X-ray is performed, as shown. Based on the clinical features and radiographic findings, what is the most likely diagnosis?

A 61-year-old woman consults a doctor due to persistent malaise for five years and presents with high blood pressure. She passes away unexpectedly within a week. The autopsy reveals her kidneys' external and bisected appearance, as shown in images. What is the most likely cause of her death?

Which of these is a true statement? Ferry’s Line-corneal epithelial iron line at the edge of filtering blebs Stockers Line-Corneal epithelial iron line at the edge of pterygium Hudson-Stahli line- visible all around the base of cone in Keratoconus Fleischer’s ring: Horizontal corneal epithelial iron line’ at the inferior one third of cornea due to aging Coat’s white ring- A form of iron deposit at the level of Bowman’s layer of cornea
Match the following suture materials with their characteristics related to absorption and tissue reactivity:

A 54-year-old woman comes to the clinic due to difficulty hearing for the past few weeks. During the neurologic examination, the physician assesses her hearing using a vibrating tuning fork. The handle of the tuning fork is placed on her left mastoid process until the sound is no longer audible. The tines are then quickly placed near the patient's left auditory meatus, and she reports hearing no sound. When the handle of the vibrating fork is placed on the middle of her forehead, she hears the vibration more strongly in her left ear than her right. This patient is most likely experiencing which of the following types of hearing loss?
questions.correct_answer: A. Conductive loss in left ear
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Conductive loss in left ear

questions.text: Mucopolysaccharide that does not contain uronic acid residue is:

A 75-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 2-week history of sharp, stabbing pain in the lower back that radiates to the back of his left leg. He also has had a loss of sensitivity around his buttocks and inner thighs as well as increased trouble urinating the last week. Two years ago, he was diagnosed with prostate cancer and was treated with radiation therapy. Neurologic examination shows reduced strength and reflexes in the left lower extremity; the right side is normal. The resting anal sphincter tone is normal but the squeeze tone is reduced. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
When assessing the quality of water, one of the statements below is incorrect. Identify which statement does not accurately describe water purification or contamination indicators.

options.label: A
options.text: Presence of Clostridial spores indicates recent contamination of water

options.label: B
options.text: Coliforms must not be detectable in any 100 ml sample of drinking water

options.label: C
options.text: Sodium thiosulphate is used to neutralize certain contaminants

options.label: D
options.text: Coliforms may be detected by multiple tube method and indole production

questions.correct_answer: A. Presence of Clostridial spores indicates recent contamination of water
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Presence of Clostridial spores indicates recent contamination of water

questions.text: An investigator studying patients with symptoms of arthritis detects nonenveloped virus with single stranded DNA genome in the serum of a pregnant patient. Fetal infection with this pathogen is most likely to cause which of the following manifestations?

A 72-year-old man with a history of hypertension experiences sudden severe chest pain that radiates to the interscapular region. Physical examination reveals bounding pulses with a wide pulse pressure and a diastolic murmur along the left sternal border. Which of the following is the most likely etiology of these symptoms?
In Piaget's theory of cognitive development, the concepts of "out of sight, out of mind" and focusing on the "here and now" are characteristic of which developmental stage?

A patient present with a 3-day history of diarrhea. Stool samples are stained using an acid-fast technique, revealing the structures shown in the image. What is the most likely pathogen causing the patient's symptoms?
Which of the following is NOT one of the three clinical diagnostic criteria for bacterial vaginosis described by Amsel?

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina

options.label: C
options.text: Clue cells seen on vaginal saline preparation by light microscopy

options.label: D
options.text: Characteristic fishy odour release with addition of potassium hydroxide to vaginal secretions

questions.correct_answer: B. Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina

questions.text: A public health researcher is conducting a study to evaluate the effectiveness of ASHA in improving community health. The researcher is using various indicators to assess the impact of ASHA's work over the past year. Which of the following is NOT considered an impact indicator for evaluating ASHA's work?

options.label: A
options.text: Number of institutional deliveries in comparison to last year

options.label: D
options.text: Number of cases of TB/Leprosy detected as compared to last year

questions.correct_answer: A. Number of institutional deliveries in comparison to last year
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Number of institutional deliveries in comparison to last year

questions.text: 56-year-old man is evaluated for dyspnea, wheezing, and cough productive of yellow sputum. The patient reports that he has been treated with antibiotics when the dyspnea is severe. He has smoked 2 packs of cigarettes daily for the past 25 years. The schematic diagram below is a representation of a bronchial wall. Which of the following ratios is the best pathological index to determine the severity of this patient's disease?

A safety officer is conducting a training session on pesticide safety and handling. To ensure that all workers understand the risk levels associated with different pesticides, the officer explains the color coding system used on pesticide labels. According to this system, which color indicates that a pesticide is the most hazardous?
All of the following are targets of the WHO global strategy for cervical cancer elimination except:

options.label: B
options.text: 70% of women screened with a high-quality test by ages 35 and 45

options.label: C
options.text: 90% of women with cervical disease receiving treatment

options.label: D
options.text: 90% girls received at least one dose of vaccine by age 28

questions.correct_answer: D. 90% girls received at least one dose of vaccine by age 28
questions.explanation: Ans. D) 90% girls received at least one dose of vaccine by age 28

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman with HIV infection comes to the emergency department because of a 4-week history of progressively worsening fatigue and headache. Her temperature is 38.1°C (100.6°F). On mental status examination, the patient is somnolent and oriented only to person. Her CD4+ lymphocyte count is 80/mm3. Analysis of this patient's cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) shows a leukocyte count of 30/mm3 (60% lymphocytes), a protein concentration of 52 mg/dL, and a glucose concentration of 37 mg/dL. Which of the following is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for this patient's neurological symptoms?

A 66-year-old woman with warfarin induced bleeding receives IV vitamin K, 4 U PRBCs and 4U FFP. 4h later, she begins to complain of shortness of breath. Vitals T - 39°C, RR 35/min, SpO2 84% on RA, and BP 88/52 mm Hg. CXR is as shown in the picture. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 55-year-old male, who is a chronic smoker, presents to the clinic with hypertension and obesity with marked hyperpigmentation. Which of the following will help in diagnosis?

A 58-year-old woman presents with a one-year history of anterior knee pain, particularly noted when climbing stairs. On examination, she has crepitus and severe restriction of knee movement beyond 110 degrees. Xray is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 5-year-old girl is brought to the physician by her mother because of a 1-month history of a painful ulcer on her face. She has developed painful sunburns in the past with minimal UV exposure. Examination of the skin shows a 2-cm ulcerated nodule on the left cheek. There are scaly, hyperpigmented papules and plaques over the skin of the entire body/ Examination of a biopsy specimen from the facial lesion shows poorly-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma. Impairment of which of the following proteins is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

A 65-year-old male with a history of atrial fibrillation and recent coronary artery bypass graft surgery presents with bleeding from the surgical wound site. Laboratory tests reveal a normal platelet count and coagulation panel. Thromboelastography (TEG) is ordered to assess the patient's clotting profile. Which of the following TEG tracings is most consistent with the patient's presentation?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced R-time, increased angle, increased MA, increased LY30

options.label: B
options.text: Prolonged R-time, decreased angle, decreased MA, decreased LY30

options.label: C
options.text: Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced R-time, decreased angle, increased MA, decreased LY30

questions.correct_answer: C. Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy has cut in forearms from 4 days back. Now granulation tissue is seen there. The type of collagen found predominantly in wound healing granulation tissue after trauma is:

A 19-year-old man comes to the physician due to diarrhea for the last 4 months. He visited a student health clinic at his university a month ago and was prescribed a course of antibiotics, but his diarrhea failed to improve. He also has persistent nausea, a bloating sensation, and a 6.8-kg weight loss. Microscopic examination of his stool is shown in the image. Impairment of which of the following immune functions would most likely predispose to this patient's infection?
The Ottawa ankle rules are primarily employed to:

options.label: A
options.text: Diagnose rupture of the Achilles tendon

options.label: B
options.text: Decide on treatment for congenital talipes equinovarus (CTEV)

options.label: C
options.text: Decide on the need for X-rays for a possible fracture

options.label: D
options.text: Decide on immediate vs. delayed treatment of ankle dislocation

questions.correct_answer: C. Decide on the need for X-rays for a possible fracture

questions.text: 36-year-old woman, gravida 3, para 2, at 31 weeks' gestation comes to the emergency department because of painless, bright red vaginal bleeding for one day. She has not felt any contractions. Her other children were delivered by Cesarean section because of breech position. Fetal heart rate is reactive with no decelerations. Which of the following findings is most likely on ultrasound?

Identify the true statements: In amyloidosis, Beta pleated sheet will be seen in X-ray crystallography. There is decrease in thyroid-binding globulin, transferrin, and fibrinogen in nephrotic syndrome. Blood transfusion requires screening of donor blood for HIV, HCV, HBV but not dengue. Massive splenomegaly is noted in hairy cell leukaemia, CML and aplastic anemia.
Which of the following statements about Depot Medroxyprogesterone Acetate (DMPA) is not true?

options.label: B
options.text: Does not have a protective effect on endometrial cancer

options.label: D
options.text: Useful in the treatment of menorrhagia

questions.correct_answer: B. Does not have a protective effect on endometrial cancer

questions.text: A 40-year-old patient undergoing long-term steroid therapy complains of sudden severe pain in the right hip. What is the preferred imaging study to evaluate this complaint?

A 25-year-old male presents to the clinic with gastrointestinal discomfort, diarrhea, and mild abdominal pain. He reports a history of camping. A stool sample is obtained, and on microscopic examination, an egg similar to the one pictured is observed. Which is the most likely mode of transmission and infective form of the parasite corresponding to this egg?

options.label: B
options.text: Ingestion of egg contaminated in water

questions.correct_answer: B. Ingestion of egg contaminated in water

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman with a known case of fibroid uterus consults for potential surgical options. She experiences symptoms that may warrant surgical intervention. Which of the following is not a typical indication for myomectomy in cases of uterine fibroids?
Which of the following is NOT a component of the Obesity Surgery-Mortality Risk Score (OS-MRS)?
The following hematoxylin and eosin-stained biopsy is from which tissue?

A medical student have given a topic to present in class. The topic given to you was excitation-contraction coupling. It is a process in which muscle cells are stimulated to contract and it is followed by muscle cell relaxation. It involves the following events: Action potential Calcium release into the cytoplasm Cross-bridge cycling Cytoplasmic calcium removal Depolarization of T tubules Which of the following options lists the correct sequence of events for excitation-contraction coupling in skeletal muscle tissue?

A 29-year-old woman, gravida 1, para 0, at 36 weeks' gestation is brought to the emergency department after an episode of dizziness and vomiting followed by loss of consciousness lasting 1 minute. She reports that her symptoms started after lying down on her back to rest, as she felt tired during yoga class. There is a prolonged fetal heart rate deceleration to 80/min. Which of the following is the most appropriate action to reverse this patient's symptoms in the future?

options.label: B
options.text: Lying in the supine position and elevating legs

options.label: C
options.text: Lying in the left lateral decubitus position

questions.correct_answer: C. Lying in the left lateral decubitus position
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Lying in the left lateral decubitus position

questions.text: A pediatric patient comes in with an infectious skin lesion on the leg. Culture of the lesion grows hemolytic colonies consisting of Gram-positive cocci in chains. Which test would be most appropriate to confirm the identity of the organism?

During an advanced airway management workshop, a resident is asked to select an appropriate laryngoscope blade for a patient with a known difficult airway due to cervical spine immobility. Which of the following laryngoscope blades is specifically designed to improve visualization of the vocal cords without the need for extensive neck manipulation?
In patients with renal failure, which imaging technique is appropriate for visualizing vessels without causing further renal impairment?

During the process of evaluating protein concentration in a laboratory setting, which of the following amino acids is primarily responsible for the absorption of ultraviolet light at a wavelength of 280 nm, allowing for the spectrophotometric analysis of protein solutions?

A pediatrician is evaluating the appropriate steps for managing non-immunized individuals who have been in contact with a confirmed case of diphtheria. Which of the following interventions are not recommended in this scenario? Prophylactic penicillin Single dose of toxoid Daily throat examination Daily throat swab culture Weekly throat swabs examination

A 55-year-old woman undergoes a minor elective laparoscopic procedure as part of a day-care surgery. Considering the need for rapid postoperative recovery and minimal residual sedation, which opioid is most suitable for intraoperative analgesia?

Identify the correct agent-disease pairings from the list provided: Lyme disease — Borrelia burgdorferi Cat-scratch disease — Bartonella henselae Glanders — Burkholderia mallei Rat bite fever — Borrelia recurrentis Trench fever — Bartonella bacilliformis

A 4-year-old boy presents with eczema, recurrent infections, and bleeding episodes. Peripheral blood smear shows the presence of small-sized platelets. Which of the following conditions is most likely associated with these findings?

A patient presented with fever, dyspnea, palpitations, and tachycardia. The echocardiography revealed vegetation in the septal leaflets. Tissue sections from them reveal the following findings as shown in the image. What is the most likely implicated agent?

options.label: A
options.text: Pigmented septate hyphae at 90 degrees, Mucormycosis

options.label: B
options.text: Right angle branching septate hyphae, Fusarium

options.label: D
options.text: Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus

questions.correct_answer: D. Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus
